channel.title: Post your system Specs
channel.description:
Post your system specs, if you don't know what they are, download Belaric Advisor from download.com.
Operating System
Windows XP Home Edition Service Pack 1 (build 2600)
Processor
3.00 gigahertz Intel Pentium 4 (Overclocked to 3.45 w/ water cooling) 16 kilobyte primary memory cache 1024 kilobyte secondary memory cache
Main Circuit Board (Why can't they just call it a mobo?)
Board: MSI MS-7058 100 Bus Clock: 800 megahertz BIOS: American Megatrends Inc. V1.5B0 02/01/2005
Memory Modules
2048 Megabytes Installed Memory
Slot 'DIMM0' has 1024 MB (serial number SerNum0) Slot 'DIMM1' is Empty Slot 'DIMM2' has 1024 MB Slot 'DIMM3' is Empty
Drives
200.04 Gigabytes Usable Hard Drive Capacity 143.64 Gigabytes Hard Drive Free Space
GENERIC DVD RW 16XMax [CD-ROM drive] VH4296H WBP686X SCSI CdRom Device [CD-ROM drive]
ST3200822A [Hard drive] (200.05 GB) -- drive 0, s/n 4LJ2RVD3, rev 3.01, SMART Status: Healthy

item.title: Post your system Specs
item.dc:creator: @Sync Sync
item.description:
@Sync wrote:

[quote=“Bobby, post:45, topic:148145”][quote author=ThugLife link=topic=203009.msg1796352#msg1796352 date=1191381127]

I built teh desktop… and no…
I dont think I’ve ever built a laptop O_O[/quote]

Oh, I see. You should probably take a course(trust me, laptop building is more complex than a standard desktop) in it, repairing laptops and building/selling them can be very profitable.

wow. i didn’t realize you could even open them up lol. that seems like it would make good moeny.

How do they even let you near a computer?

iwth a restraining order?

i ment a laptop. i knew you coud open desktops[/quote]You don’t understand, look at the back of a laptop and you might see something.

Read full topic

item.title: Post your system Specs
item.dc:creator: @TeeBaggie TeeBaggie
item.description:
@TeeBaggie wrote:

[quote=“FastBawlz, post:42, topic:148145”][quote author=TeeBaggie link=topic=203009.msg1798608#msg1798608 date=1191469582]
If you are wanting something really nice, I prefer the ATI Radeon HD2600. Its about 120$ at newegg, and one of the best cards I’ve ever used.
[/quote]

I’m going to buy a 1950PRO or XT from Sapphire.

Not going to bother buying a DX10 card thats cheap, they cant handle DX10 games.

Specs:

OS: Vista Home Premium.
RAM: 2gB
HD: 250gB
External HD: 250gB
CPU: Intel Core 2 Duo E4400 @ 2.0 GHz
Video Card: Doesn’t matter, it sucks.
Resolution: 1600x1200 @ 60Hz[/quote]
Thats a great one too, I had that same one from sapphire the one with 512mb, and It was great, although it stopped working after about 6 months…
Good thing it was still in warranty.
And they are not that cheap anymore, it was a special…

Read full topic

Brilliant, but i have to get a new graphics card
[/quote]If you are wanting something really nice, I prefer the ATI Radeon HD2600. Its about 120$ at newegg, and one of the best cards I’ve ever used.[/quote]
I’m going for an nvidia, I’ve currently got an ATI Radeon X1600, but it still has trouble trying to power a 22" monitor.
I’ve already got an nvidia motherboard, I just couldn’t afford a decent graphics card at the time :(.

http://i200.photobucket.com/albums/aa39/TheChosen1com/P1020015.jpg

http://i200.photobucket.com/albums/aa39/TheChosen1com/P1020014.jpg

  • Antec Ninehundred Case

  • 4gb DDR2 800mhz

  • AMD x2 6000+ Processor

  • ATI Radeon HD 2600
    256mb GDDR4

    256mb GDDR4 (yes I have 2 and they are crossfired)

  • RAID (2) 80gb HDD’s

  • Acer 22" Widescreen

  • Windows XP Pro

MY LAPTOP

  • HP DV9000

  • 3gb DDR2 800mhz

  • 17" Widescreen

  • GeForce Go7600 256mb GDDR2

  • Windows Vista Home Premium

MY OTHER LAPTOP
